content.body: Okay, there is actually a reasonable amount of testing round this (under its es5 section id), but it's all the `TypeError` cases rather than checking that the arguments are not evaluated if the evaluation of the reference expression itself caused a `ReferenceError` to be raised.
content.formatted_body: Okay, there is actually a reasonable amount of testing round this (under its es5 section id), but it's all the TypeError cases rather than checking that the arguments are not evaluated if the evaluation of the reference expression itself caused a ReferenceError to be raised.
